comments: Let I=I_n be the n X n identity matrix and P=P_n be the incidence matrix of the cycle (1,2,3,...,n). Then, for n>=3, a(n) is the number of (0,1) n X n matrices A<=P^(-1)+I+P with exactly two 1's in every row and column. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 11 2010
